What is "sudo"?
sudo = superuser od
the super user, or root user, is like the ultimate user on the system with permission to do just about anything
to go permanently into super user mode type "sudo -s" but be careful cause you can do some serious damage as super user
You're confusing the root user with the root directory
/ is the root directory. It's called "root" because the directory structure is like a tree, with "root" at the bottom
The directories are like branches of the tree and the files like the leaves, hence the analogy
The "root account" is a user account with permission to do just about anything on the system, like create new users and edit protected files
